pageTitle: Itinerary for Tuesday, June 27, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Tuesday, June 27, 2017:

Ottawa, Ontario

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks and hold a media availability.

National Press Theatre
150 Wellington Street
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Journalists who are not members of the Canadian Parliamentary Press Gallery will require accreditation from the gallery in advance. For more information, contact Marc Fortier at marc.fortier@parl.gc.ca.
  • Out-of-town journalists can also dial in to listen to the news conference. Please note these will be set up as listen-only mode lines. International callers must dial the local phone number for proper access.

Participant dial-in numbers

Local: 613-960-7518
Toll-free:  1-866-805-7923
Pass code:  7373368#

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks and participate in a Q&A session with students at Berrigan Elementary School to mark Multiculturalism Day.

Berrigan Elementary School
199 Berrigan Drive
Nepean, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 1:30pm.

7:00 p.m. The Prime Minister and Mrs. Grégoire Trudeau will attend the State Dinner given by Their Excellencies the Right Honourable David Johnston, Governor General of Canada, and Mrs. Sharon Johnston in honour of a state visit to Canada by Sergio Mattarella, the President of Italy.

Ballroom, Rideau Hall
1 Sussex Drive
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Pooled coverage of remarks and toasts at the beginning of the dinner
  • Media should arrive no later than 6:30 p.m.
  • To cover events at Rideau Hall, media representatives must be accredited in advance by the Parliamentary Press Gallery and must confirm their attendance with the Rideau Hall Press Office:

Marie-Ève Létourneau
613-998-0287
613-302-0912 (cell)
marie-eve.letourneau@gg.ca

  • For further accreditation information, please contact the Press Gallery at 613-992-6517 or email pressres2@parl.gc.ca.

Media Appearance

1:45 p.m. An interview with the Prime Minister will be broadcast live on Red 93.1 FM Vancouver.

Please note: all times are local.
